knimeNode.name: Inject Column Properties
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node inserts column properties from a second input table into the columns from the first input table

intro.p:
This node adds column properties from a table of new properties to the existing input table. The second input table provides the new column properties, and must have the first three columns as String columns with the names
Column Name
Property Name
Property Value
Existing properties are optionally overwritten or retained according to the node settings

Note:
It is not possible to change the order of properties for an individual column in the column properties table
All column properties are stored as text/String values regardless of what they represent
If the same column name / property name occurs more than once in the input table, only the last value will be applied to the output table
This node was developed by Vernalis Research (Cambridge, UK) . For feedback and more information, please contact knime@vernalis.com

fullDescription.option: Should existing properties from the incoming table be cleared prior to applying the new properties?
If existing properties are cleared, should they be cleared from all incoming columns, or only those with new properties?
If existing properties are being retained, should a new value for an existing property overwrite the existing value?

option.name: Use incoming table spec during configure

fullDescription.option: Most of the time, using the incoming table spec for the output table during the node configuration will not cause any problems, and allow downstream nodes to be configured. In this case, the output will at configure have the incoming properties regardless of the node settings. If this causes a problem, then uncheck this option, in which case a table spec will not be available at the output until the node is executed

ports.inPort: Incoming data table to apply the properties to
The incoming table containing the properties. See above for detailed requirements. NB In KNIME, all properties are stored as text
ports.outPort: The input table with modified column properties
